thread.title_full: SkyWest Reports Combined July 2015 Traffic for SkyWest Airlines and ExpressJet AirlinesTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: SkyWest Reports Combined July 2015 Traffic for SkyWest Airlines and ExpressJet AirlinesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
SkyWest Reports Combined July 2015 Traffic for SkyWest Airlines and ExpressJet Airlines
SkyWest today reported 183,039 block hours in July 2015, compared to 204,175 block hours in July 2014, a decrease of 21,136, or 10.4%. The net decrease was consistent with SkyWest’s fleet optimization plan to improve the mix of aircraft in its fleet by adding new dual-class aircraft to its fleet and reducing unprofitable aircraft.
The year-over-year net change included approximately 10,400 additional block hours from its additional 76-seat E175 aircraft and 30,000 fewer block hours from the reduction in the 50-seat jetaircraft operating fleet.
In July 2015, SkyWest’s dual class aircraft represented approximately 38% of SkyWest’s total block hour production for the month compared to approximately 30% for the month of July 2014.
SkyWest reported 1,231,186 block hours year-to-date through July 2015, compared to 1,330,058 block hours through July 2014, a decrease of 98,872, or 7.4%. This net change included approximately 56,700 additional block hours from SkyWest’s 76-seat E175 aircraft and 150,275 fewer block hours from the reduction in the 50-seat jet and 30-seat turboprop aircraft in its operating fleet.
SkyWest had 109,016 departures in July 2015 compared to 123,244 in July 2014, a decrease of 14,228, or 11.5%. SkyWest generated 3.21 billion available seat miles for July 2015, compared to 3.48 billion ASMs for July 2014, or a 7.7% decrease.
Source:-SkyWest
